description: The sword was broken when straightening it at the time of discovery. A wooden plate with two rivets has been attached to fix it together. There are two rivet holes each side of the V shaped shoulder (two rivets still in position) and 2 in the hilt with what appears to be the start of a third between them. The hilt is not flanged. The edge of the point is somewhat damaged. Mainly in good condition with a few spots of bronze disease.
publications: See Transactions Cumb. & West [...]. and Arch. Soc. (O.S.) XV, 164-5; also (N.S) LXV, 47-52,Proc. Barrow Naturalists Field Club. vol. XVII, p. 213.
